TEI.2.document_title: Joseph W. Brown to Stephen F. Austin, 11-14-1826

*div1 type="summary"* *p*Inquiries concerning constable's fees.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*To *person_mentioned*Col. Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Respected Sir The *person_mentioned*Alcaldas of this District*/person_mentioned* have been pleased to confide to me the office of *person_mentioned*Constable */person_mentioned*and in making out bills of cost I have invariably charged (except in case of warrants where I was commanded to find the body and bring it forthwith) mileage from the*location_mentioned* office of the *person_mentioned*Alcalde*/person_mentioned**/location_mentioned* to the *location_mentioned*place of residence of the *person_mentioned*person summoned*/person_mentioned**/location_mentioned* whether I found him at home or elsewhere—this is complained of by some though I thought hardly any rule was more uniformly and universally established—As we are about to fall under your jurisdiction and such matters will sooner or later be refered to you I request that you will do me the favour to state to me whether I have misconceived the rule or not and if I have erred to state what the rule is—*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Atascosito District*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="11-14-1826">Nov. 14th 1826*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Joseph W. Brown*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*P. S. I know not who will be the *person_mentioned*bearer */person_mentioned*of this letter but if he returns to this *location_mentioned*District*/location_mentioned* I pray you will send an answer to my request by him—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*J. W. B.*/person_mentioned**/p* */div1*
